title: England v South Africa: Women’s Cricket World Cup – live
summary: Nat Sciver's team begins their campaign against South Africa in Guwahati, with live updates provided by our writers throughout the match. The report offers an over-by-over analysis of the game. Stay tuned for ongoing commentary and insights.

title: Manchester synagogue victim died after being shot by police, as attacker’s father expresses ‘sorrow’ at killings – latest
summary: Faraj al-Shamie publicly denounced his son's actions, expressing disapproval on behalf of the family. The statement indicates a clear separation between the family’s values and the son's behavior. This condemnation highlights internal family conflict and disassociation from the son's choices.

title: Stride dismisses suggestion Badenoch will be ousted as Tory leader next year but admits ‘it’s going to be bumpy’ – UK politics live
summary: The shadow chancellor expresses support for the party leader while refraining from endorsing her assertion that Britain is at risk of an IMF bailout. This indicates a division in the party's stance on economic concerns. The statement reflects ongoing tensions regarding the country's financial stability.

title: Calls for police to shoot down drones after Munich airport disruption – latest updates
summary: The Bavarian Prime Minister is advocating for enhanced air defenses in Germany following a recent incident. This call comes amidst growing concerns about national security. Officials emphasize the need for improved measures to protect the country's airspace.

title: Brentford rise above snobbery to remain awkward, all-action opponents
summary: Keith Andrews' team has experienced mixed results, yet their proficiency in set-pieces is aiding them in navigating recent challenges. This strategic focus is aligning with the club's broader framework. Overall, the approach reflects a positive adaptation to pressure situations.
